definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)

sentences.english: Will enhance the integrity to a world without it can not conduct the realm.
sentences.chinese: 更将诚信提升到了一个立身于世无它不可的境界。
他在她进来时起立身来。

sentences.english: "Service" is the guidance principle and the basis to success of SMEE , we are striving all along.
sentences.chinese: 服务是志诚企业的宗旨和立身之本，我们一直在努力。

sentences.english: How could I fail you once again, your love is what sustains me.
sentences.chinese: 我怎么能再次失败，你，你的爱是我立身。

sentences.english: The cultivation and development of political quality are as social person's foundation which sets up the body.
sentences.chinese: 政治素质的培养与发展是一个社会人的立身之本。

sentences.english: You can realize a wonderful relationship with the Holy Spirit by living The Two Great Commandments.
sentences.chinese: 以“两大诫命”立身，就能与圣灵美好相处。

sentences.english: Lastly, ethics is the stander to supervise oneself.
sentences.chinese: 再次，道德是个体立身行事的依归。

sentences.english: This is also the principle of the Company to conduct and expand the foundation.
sentences.chinese: 这也是本公司立身的原则和拓展的基础。

sentences.english: Dream-limitless but realistic ambition the vision of a glorious and honorable future.
sentences.chinese: 梦想，立身今日，心系未来，驶向明日辉煌荣耀之路。

sentences.english: The guiding theory in palace style literature is the difference between being a proper person and writing good articles.
sentences.chinese: “立身之道与文章异”，这是宫体创作的主导理论。

sentences.english: Life here teaches you to function in a social environment.
sentences.chinese: 这里的生活教会你如何在社会上立身处世。

sentences.english: Say, don't you learn "li", can't scarcely in society.
sentences.chinese: 就是说，你不学“礼”，就没法在社会中立身。

sentences.english: They are principles in which my father believed and by which he governed his life.
sentences.chinese: 它们是先父深信不移和立身处世的信条。

definition: settle down and get on with one's pursuit
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)
you (used to a superior or between persons of the same generation)/below the foot
see 誠心誠意|诚心诚意[cheng2 xin1 cheng2 yi4]
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
adopted name of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2]
